# Vista Core Library The Vista Core Library provides the foundational UI framework for building desktop and web applications using Arturo's VID (Visual Interface Dialect). ## Core Features - **Declarative UI**: Build user interfaces using the VID syntax - **Component System**: Rich set of pre-built UI components - **Layout Engine**: Flexible layout system with rows, columns, and grids - **Data Binding**: Automatic state synchronization with UI - **Event System**: Comprehensive event handling model ## Documentation Sections - [Concepts](/vista/wiki/core/concepts/) - Core concepts and architecture - [Tutorials](/vista/wiki/core/tutorials/) - Step-by-step learning guides - [Components](/vista/wiki/core/components/) - UI component reference - [Layout](/vista/wiki/core/layout/) - Layout system documentation - [Data Binding](/vista/wiki/core/data-binding/) - State management and binding - [Events](/vista/wiki/core/events/) - Event handling documentation - [API Reference](/vista/wiki/core/api-reference/) - Complete function reference ## Quick Start `view .html [ title "My Application" text "Welcome to Vista!" button "Click Me" [print "Clicked!"] ]` ## See Also - [Getting Started](/vista/wiki/getting-started/) - Quick start guide - [Vista Graphics](/vista/wiki/graphics/) - Graphics and drawing library
